name: Lightweight Alloy Hull
description: Standard hull fitted to most stock ships. Offers minimal protection but is extremely light, maximizing speed and jump range.

name: Reinforced Alloy Hull
description: An upgrade over lightweight alloy, reinforced hull provides modest protection without sacrificing too much speed or range.

name: Mirrored Composite Hull
description: Mirrored composite hull is optimized to resist thermal damage (e.g., lasers and plasma). It has reduced kinetic resistance.

name: Reactive Composite Hull
description: Reactive composite hull provides superior kinetic resistance, ideal for defense against ballistic and multi-cannon weapons.

name: Military Grade Composite
description: Military composite is a well-rounded upgrade used in many combat ships. It offers strong protection against all damage types and is favored by bounty hunters and PvP pilots.

name: Hull Reinforcement Package (HRP)
description: HRPs add additional hull hitpoints to your ship. They are internal modules stacked on top of the base armor to absorb damage before critical systems are hit.

name: Module Reinforcement Package (MRP)
description: MRPs protect internal modules from taking damage when the hull is breached. They're crucial for PvP, AX combat, and endurance builds.

name: Frame Shift Drive
description: The Frame Shift Drive (FSD) is the core module responsible for supercruise travel within star systems and hyperspace jumps between them.

name: Power Plant
description: The power plant supplies energy to all ship systems. A stronger plant allows for more powerful modules and weapons, while better quality plants produce less heat.

name: Thrusters
description: Thrusters control a ship’s sublight movement, including linear thrust and lateral/vertical maneuvering. Thruster quality affects speed, agility, and boost capabilities.

name: Power Distributor
description: This module manages power allocation between systems (SYS), engines (ENG), and weapons (WEP). Higher-grade distributors recharge faster and hold larger power reserves.

name: Life Support
description: Life support systems supply breathable atmosphere in the cockpit and suit. If the canopy breaches, it provides emergency oxygen until the ship is repaired or docked.

name: Sensors
description: Sensors control your ability to detect and scan objects in space. Higher-grade sensors increase range and detail, especially useful in scanning or bounty hunting.

name: Fuel Tank
description: The fuel tank stores hydrogen fuel used for Frame Shift Drive jumps and thruster operations. Larger tanks allow for longer operations without refueling.

name: Beam Laser
description: Beam lasers emit continuous energy beams that quickly deplete enemy shields. They’re most effective against shielded targets but generate high heat.

name: Pulse Laser
description: Pulse lasers fire rapid energy bursts and are known for efficiency and heat management. They're ideal for consistent shield damage and versatile builds.

name: Burst Laser
description: Burst lasers fire 3-shot bursts and offer a middle ground between beams and pulse lasers. They do more damage per burst at higher energy cost.

name: Multi-Cannon
description: Multi-cannons fire ballistic projectiles at high rate. They are excellent against hulls and have great ammo efficiency, making them ideal for prolonged fights.

name: Cannon
description: Cannons fire heavy rounds that deal massive hull damage on impact. They're most effective against large, slow targets and in close-range engagements.

name: Railgun
description: Railguns fire high-velocity projectiles that ignore some defenses. Used for sniping modules, disabling power plants, and delivering experimental effects.

name: Plasma Accelerator
description: Plasma accelerators fire slow-moving energy orbs that deal huge damage to both shields and hull. They're power-hungry and difficult to aim but devastating.

name: Fragment Cannon
description: Frag cannons fire high-spread kinetic bursts at short range. Effective in close quarters, especially against hulls or for disabling modules.

name: Mining Laser
description: Mining lasers are used to extract raw materials from asteroids. These are non-combat modules essential for all mining operations.

name: Missile Rack
description: Missile racks deliver targeted explosive payloads. They're good against modules and hulls but limited by ammo and ineffective vs. shields.

name: Torpedo Pylon
description: Torpedoes deal massive explosive damage and are often used to destroy power plants or high-value targets. Expensive and ammo-limited.

name: Shock Cannon
description: Shock Cannons are rapid-fire energy weapons that disrupt flight controls and modules. Limited in range and mostly used for utility or roleplay.

name: Fuel Scoop
description: A fuel scoop allows a ship to collect hydrogen fuel from stars with a scoopable classification (O, B, A, F, G, K, M). It's essential for long-range travel without constant station stops.

name: Cargo Rack
description: Cargo racks determine how much standard cargo your ship can carry. Larger racks are key to trading, mining, and mission hauling.

name: Passenger Cabin
description: Passenger cabins allow you to accept transport missions, carrying tourists, refugees, or VIPs to destinations. Available in economy, business, first class, and luxury variants.

name: Fighter Hangar
description: This module stores and launches ship-launched fighters (SLFs). Used in combat support, multi-crew combat, and large ship defense.

name: Refinery
description: The refinery processes raw asteroid fragments into tradable materials. A mandatory module for any mining vessel.

name: Collector Limpet Controller
description: Collector limpets retrieve cargo, materials, or fragments and bring them to the ship. An essential quality-of-life module for mining or salvage.

name: Prospector Limpet Controller
description: Prospector limpets analyze asteroids for mineral content and increase yield when deployed. Must-have for core and laser mining.

name: Detailed Surface Scanner
description: This module maps planets, revealing landable terrain, geological signals, and biological features. It's also required for exobiology.

name: Auto Field Maintenance Unit (AFMU)
description: The AFMU can repair most ship modules (except the hull) without docking. It’s often used during deep-space exploration to recover from module wear.

name: Shield Cell Bank
description: A SCB quickly restores depleted shields by consuming stored energy. It's widely used in PvE combat and some PvP builds.

name: Shield Booster
description: Shield boosters increase your total shield strength. They’re a cornerstone of shield-tank builds and widely used in both PvP and PvE combat.

name: Chaff Launcher
description: Chaff launchers distort your heat and shield signature, throwing off gimballed and turreted weapons. An essential defensive tool in evasive combat.

name: Heat Sink Launcher
description: Heat sinks rapidly vent heat from your ship. Useful for silent running, exploration near stars, or to prevent module damage from overheating.

name: Point Defense
description: Point defense turrets automatically shoot down incoming missiles and hatch breaker limpets. They are passive modules that activate when needed.

name: Kill Warrant Scanner
description: KWS reveals all outstanding bounties on a target across multiple jurisdictions. Maximizes credit income for bounty hunters.

name: Manifest Scanner
description: Scans a ship’s cargo hold, revealing its manifest. Used for piracy, smuggling interdictions, and black market targeting.

name: Xeno Scanner
description: A specialized scanner that analyzes Thargoid ships and reveals weak points. Required for efficient anti-xeno combat.

name: Frame Shift Wake Scanner
description: Allows you to scan high-energy FSD wakes to follow ships that jump to another system. Useful for tracking targets or data gathering.

name: Electronic Countermeasure (ECM)
description: The ECM pulses your ship with disruptive energy, disabling or scrambling incoming missiles and some limpets. Niche but effective with timing.
